column4: xfce doesn't use a whole lot less RAM though - see http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=article&item=linux_desktop_vitals&num=1 for comparison of Gnome,Xfce,KDE,Lxde
my bad. I had always heard that it was and it seemed much faster on my computer. But I use awesomewm now and that probably uses a tenth the memory of either
it wasn't really "your bad", your statement was correct, i just wanted to point out that it's not a huge difference :)
